pros:
- Friendly Coworkers
- Management wants you to succeed
- Students are driven and love to be there
cons: Have not found any, and I doubt I ever will.
Hours are not guaranteed (changes per semester)

job_title: Human Resource Intern in Vancouver, BC
pros: Endless flow of task. As a rapidly growing organization with a small HR team, Arts Umbrella always has a project in motion so there's never a boring moment. With a small team you get to experience hands on connections and impact of your work. The relationship built amongst co-workers are natural and positive! From co-workers to Directors, Arts Umbrella has a very welcoming environment.
cons: Due to the small nature of the HR department in the organization, the HR team and workers are stretched thin. Thankfully, everyone is very understanding and willing to accomadate.

job_title: Visual Arts Instructor in Surrey, BC
pros: Creative freedom, varied opportunities, nice facilities
cons:
Low pay for assistants and lack of transparency about how to earn more
Lack of training and unclear expectations

review_title: Arts Umbrella is a fantastic place that provides a great education in visual arts, dance, and theatre.
pros: You get to see kids excel in artistic pursuits.
cons: It is a very challenging place to work.  The CEO has terrible (or no) leadership skills and that filters down through the ranks.  There is a reason there is very high turnover at Arts Umbrella.
